text:
Giant of the urban edge,/ Redwood tower fortified/ And flanking the crosswalk

/ You stand corralled and cordoned off/ By short-fenced lining.

/ A net of flies frenzies/ At your base,/ Strips and mines the layered decay.

/ Brown thatchery to bark/ To spiral branches/ Spindling deepest green/ In the isolate canopy.

/ I would stay a while if.../
